jobs.title: Senior Manager, Advanced Analytics – Sportsbook
jobs.description:
ABOUT FANDUEL

FanDuel Group is the premier mobile gaming company in the United States. FanDuel Group consists of a portfolio of leading brands across mobile wagering including, America’s #1 Sportsbook FanDuel Sportsbook, its leading iGaming platform FanDuel Casino, the industry’s unquestioned leader in horse racing and advance-deposit wagering, FanDuel Racing and its daily fantasy sports product.

In addition, FanDuel Group operates FanDuel TV, its broadly distributed linear cable television network and FanDuel TV+, its leading direct-to-consumer OTT platform. FanDuel Group has a presence across all 50 states and Puerto Rico with approximately 17 million customers and 31 retail locations.

The company is based in New York with offices in Los Angeles, Atlanta and Jersey City, as well as in Canada, Scotland, Ireland, Portugal, Romania and Australia.

FanDuel Group is a subsidiary of Flutter Entertainment, the world's largest sports betting and gaming operator with a portfolio of globally recognized brands and traded on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: FLUT).

THE ROSTER

At FanDuel, we give fans a new and innovative way to interact with their favorite games, sports and teams. We’re dedicated to building a winning team and we pride ourselves on being able to make every moment mean more, especially when it comes to your career. So, what does “winning” look like at FanDuel? It’s recognition for your hard-earned results, a culture that brings out your best work—and a roster full of talented coworkers. Make no mistake, we are here to win, but we believe in winning right. That means we’ll never compromise when it comes to looking out for our teammates. From creatives professionals to cutting edge technology innovators, FanDuel offers a wide range of career opportunities, best in class benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. At FanDuel, our principle of “We Are One Team” runs through all our offices across the globe, and you can expect to be a part of an exciting company with many opportunities to grow and be successful.

THE POSITION
Our roster has an opening with your name on it

We are looking for a Lead Advanced Analytics Analyst to join our team in Customer Operations. The analyst will support stakeholders across the online sportsbook product and customer service. They will play an important role in assisting with the development of projects focused on improving the sportsbook product customer experience. They will be responsible for journey mapping, monitoring customer service contacts and KPIs to identify pain points and measure the success of product initiatives. In time, a successful analyst will be able to effectively illustrate the sportsbook player experience based on available customer data. They will use this data to provide actionable insights to relevant teams.

 

THE GAME PLAN
Everyone on our team has a part to play

  • Deliver analytical insights and implications through the customer lens that supports and guides strategic thinking.
  • Leads a team of professional analysts focused on both business results as well as employee mentoring and personal growth.
  • Engage and influence C-Level executives & leaders with strategic recommendations based on customer analytics.
  • Key leader in Voice of the Customer & Insights, supporting the integration of efforts in Customer Analytics, Data Science, Customer Research, Competitive Intelligence, Customer Service, and Advanced Analytics.
  • Identifies and communicates key responsibilities and practices to ensure the organization promotes a successful attitude, confidence in leadership, and teamwork to achieve business results.
  • Evaluate existing user journeys across all aspects of Sportsbook, including but not limited to Marketing, Product, Commercial, Engineering, Fraud and Payments.
  • Responsible for business case development, big data analytics and/or modeling using tools (Ex. Including but not limited to Tableau, Quantum Metrics, Amazon Redshift, Amplitude, Azure, Salesforce) as well as delivery of insights.
  • Quantifies significance of data variances, applies an array of statistical methods ranging from traditional to newly developing within the Big Data space.
  • Work closely with Product, Commercial, Marketing, Customer Service and other teams to understand analytical and reporting requirements and turn these into tracking specifications for the development teams.
  • Supporting the production and distribution of web data and insights across the business
  • Responsible for strategic business recommendations through data gathering and analytics using advanced modeling techniques to predict outcomes. 
  • Familiarity with databases and tools such as Tableau, Salesforce, Amazon Redshift.
  • Uses traditional modeling techniques to build models that support decision making.
  • Identify gaps in data to enhance holistic storytelling of strategic initiatives and end to end customer experience journeys.
  • Identify and/or create metrics in the pursuit of providing a differentiated view of the customer.

 

THE STATS
What we're looking for in our next teammate

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering, Business Analytics or another relevant discipline. Master’s degree preferred.
  • 8-10 years of experience in a Customer Experience, Sportsbook/Gaming and/or Analytical Role
  • Must be able to attain required regulatory Licensure(s)
  • Expertise with SQL, Excel and Tableau (Or similar visualization tools)
  • Ability to take on complicated problems and turn them into simple, analytical frameworks.
  • Excellent Communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.
  • Knowledge of Sports Betting and Online Gambling platforms is a plus.

 

PLAYER BENEFITS
We treat our team right

From our many opportunities for professional development to our generous insurance and paid leave policies, we’re committed to making sure our employees get as much out of FanDuel as we ask them to give. Competitive compensation is just the beginning. As part of our team, you can expect:

  • An exciting and fun environment committed to driving real growth
  • Opportunities to build really cool products that fans love
  • Career and professional development resources to help you refine your game plan for owning and driving your career and development
  • Be well, save well and live well - with FanDuel Total Rewards your benefits are one highlight reel after another

FanDuel is an equal opportunities employer and we believe, as one of our principal states, “We Are One Team!”  We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, creed, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, Veteran status, or another other characteristic protected by state, local or federal law. We believe FanDuel is strongest and best able to compete if all employees feel valued, respected, and included.  We want our team to include diverse individuals because diversity of thought, diversity of perspectives, and diversity of experiences leads to better performance.  Having a diverse and inclusive workforce is a core value that we believe makes FanDuel stronger and more competitive as One Team!

The applicable salary range for this position is $118,000 - $161,700, which is dependent on a variety of factors including relevant experience, location, business needs and market demand. This role may offer the following benefits: medical, vision, and dental insurance; life insurance; disability insurance; a 401(k) matching program; among other employee benefits. This role may also be eligible for short-term or long-term incentive compensation, including, but not limited to, cash bonuses and stock program participation. This role includes paid personal time off and 14 paid company holidays. FanDuel offers paid sick time in accordance with all applicable state and federal laws.

jobs.title: Human Resources Data Analyst
jobs.description:
Eleks Compensation & Benefits is looking for Human Resources Data Analyst in Ukraine.
The Human Resources Data Analyst plays a critical role in leveraging data analytics to enhance HR decision-making processes and improve overall organizational performance. The position requires a strong analytical mindset, proficiency in data analysis tools, and a deep understanding of HR metrics.

This role will involve handling HR dashboards, reports, and ad-hoc requests while also preparing data for audits and surveys. Additionally, the analyst will be involved into HRMS implementation. This position requires a data-driven mindset and the ability to provide quick and effective solutions to Executive team members queries.


REQUIREMENTS
  • Proven experience in HR analytics, data analysis, or a similar role
  • Proficiency in HR analytics tools such as Excel, SQL, Power BI, Tableau, or Google Data Studio
  • Hands-on experience with HRIS (e.g., Workday, SAP SuccessFactors) is a plus
  • Knowledge of statistical analysis software is an advantage; understanding of HR metrics and benchmarks
  • Strong ability to analyze and interpret HR data to provide actionable insights
  • Experience in developing and maintaining HR dashboards and reporting systems
  • Bachelor's degree in Data Analytics, Human Resources, Business, Statistics, Finance or a related field
  • Upper-intermediate level of English
  • Strong problem-solving skills with a proactive approach to data-driven decision-making
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, capable of translating complex data insights into actionable recommendations
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment


    • RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Collect, clean, and maintain HR data from various sources, ensuring data integrity and accuracy
  • Develop, maintain, and enhance HR reports and dashboards to provide insights into workforce trends and metrics
  • Analyze HR data to identify trends, patterns, and insights related to employee performance, remuneration, turnover, recruitment, and engagement
  • Prepare and present regular as well as ad-hoc reports to HR leadership, providing actionable insights to inform strategic and timely decision-making
  • Respond to ad-hoc data requests from other teams, management, and executives, ensuring accuracy and timely delivery
  • Automate all people-related reports and dashboards
  • Conduct analysis on employee demographics, skills, and competencies to support succession planning
  • Design and implement metrics to measure the effectiveness of HR programs and initiatives
  • Monitor and report on HR metrics, ensuring alignment with organizational goals
  • Identify opportunities for process improvements within HR operations through data analysis
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance HR systems and processes
  • Ensure compliance with data protection regulations and internal policies regarding employee data
  • Prepare and provide data for audits, compliance checks, and internal/external surveys
  • Assist in audits and compliance reviews related to HR data management
  • Provide training and support to HR, management and executives teams on HR data reflected in Power BI
  • Contribute to the HRMS (Workday) implementation, ensuring seamless integration of people analytics and dashboard functionalities
  • Ensure data integrity, security, and governance across all HR reporting and analytics functions


    • WHAT WILL YOU GET WITH ELEKS
  • Competitive Social package
  • Close cooperation with a customer
  • Challenging tasks
  • Competence development
  • Team of professionals
  • Dynamic environment with low level of bureaucracy
  • Medical insurance

jobs.title: Senior Data & Marketing Analyst
jobs.description:
Senior Data & Marketing Analyst
Full-time, Remote

About Us:


At The Global Talent Co., we provide opportunities to work with leading innovative technology companies worldwide, offering stable employment, competitive compensation, career growth, and access to a community of 25k+ like-minded marketing professionals.

The company you will work with is a fast-growing, data-driven organization dedicated to leveraging analytics for strategic decision-making in marketing and business operations. They specialize in optimizing digital advertising performance, market trend forecasting, and providing data-driven insights to enhance overall business growth. With a commitment to innovation and efficiency, the company fosters a collaborative and results-driven environment for data professionals.

The Role:


As a Senior Data & Marketing Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in analyzing marketing data, developing predictive models, and providing actionable insights that drive strategic growth. You will work with cross-functional teams to enhance digital marketing performance, optimize advertising spend, and refine data-driven business strategies.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Analyze marketing campaign performance across Google Ads, Meta Ads, and other digital platforms to optimize ROI.

  • Develop and maintain dashboards and automated reports using tools like Power BI, Tableau, and SQL to track key performance metrics.

  • Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify trends, opportunities, and actionable insights for business growth.

  • Build and refine predictive models and forecasting techniques to anticipate market trends and campaign outcomes.

  • Provide weekly and monthly reports to senior leadership, summarizing key insights and recommendations.

  • Collaborate with digital marketing and business strategy teams to improve data-driven decision-making.

  • Monitor large-scale advertising accounts and assess performance to maximize engagement and conversions.

  • Ensure data accuracy, validation, and integrity across multiple sources.

Requirements:

  • 5+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or marketing analytics.

  • Strong proficiency in SQL, Microsoft Excel, Power BI, and Tableau.

  • Expertise in Google Ads, Meta Ads, and other digital marketing platforms (certifications preferred).

  • Experience working with large datasets, developing reports, and providing actionable insights.

  • Familiarity with predictive modeling, A/B testing, and performance forecasting.

  • Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to present complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.

  • Experience in e-commerce, SaaS, or digital marketing environments is a plus.

This is your opportunity to make a tangible impact within a rapidly growing company dedicated to transforming the future of work. Join a team that values creativity, initiative, and results!

At The Global Talent Co., our mission is to bridge the gap between leading global tech companies and amazing global talent. We believe everyone deserves equal access to opportunities, regardless of the country they are born in.

jobs.title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
jobs.description:
Restaurant365 is a SaaS company disrupting the restaurant industry! Our cloud-based platform provides a unique, centralized solution for accounting and back-office operations for restaurants. Restaurant365’s culture is focused on empowering team members to produce top-notch results while elevating their skills. We’re constantly evolving and improving to make sure we are and always will be “Best in Class” ... and we want that for you too!

As a Senior Marketing Data Analyst at Restaurant365, you’ll be the go-to expert for turning data into game-changing insights! Reporting to the Senior Manager of Marketing Operations, you’ll work side by side with Demand Gen, Sales, and Finance to unlock new opportunities, optimize performance, and fuel pipeline growth. If you love diving into B2B marketing analytics, Domo BI, and Salesforce, and get a thrill from solving complex data puzzles, this role is built for you. You’ll play a key part in shaping strategy, fine-tuning attribution models, and making sure every marketing dollar works smarter.  


How you'll add value:
  • Marketing Analytics & Performance Measurement: Develop and maintain marketing performance dashboards in Domo BI and Salesforce, ensuring real-time insights into pipeline impact, lead velocity, and conversion rates; track and analyze multi-touch attribution (MTA) using Salesforce and Marketo Measure (formerly Bizible) to assess marketing’s contribution to revenue; conduct deep-dive analysis on campaign effectiveness, pipeline trends, and ROI to optimize marketing spend and improve lead-to-customer conversion; automate data ingestion and transformation workflows in Domo, ensuring accurate and scalable reporting. 
  • Lead Funnel & Attribution Modeling: Own lead funnel analytics, tracking progression from MQL to SQL, and aligning reporting with Sales and Marketing stakeholders; enhance and maintain attribution models (first touch, last touch, multi-touch) to measure campaign influence on closed-won deals; work with Marketing Operations to ensure accurate lead source tracking and attribution in Salesforce. 
  • Data Integrity & CRM Management: Collaborate with RevOps and Marketing Ops to maintain clean, structured, and enriched data within Salesforce and Marketo; identify gaps in lead scoring and segmentation strategies to improve audience targeting and personalization; ensure data governance best practices are followed for campaign tracking, UTM structure, and reporting consistency. 
  • Experimentation & Optimization: support A/B testing for ad campaigns, landing pages, and email marketing efforts, measuring statistical significance and impact; analyze paid media, ABM, and event performance to optimize budget allocation based on CAC and LTV; provide insights into account-based marketing (ABM) performance and intent data trends for Enterprise and Field Sales teams.  


    • What you'll need to be successful in this role:
  • 5-7 years of work experience in analytical/ quantitative roles 
  • 5+ years of experience in Marketing Analytics, Business Operations, or Revenue Operations in a B2B SaaS environment.  
  • Expertise (and willingness to obtain certification) in Domo BI (or similar tools like Tableau, Looker, or Power BI), with experience in data visualization and ETL workflows.  
  • Strong proficiency in Salesforce reporting, campaign tracking, and attribution modeling.  
  • Hands-on experience with Marketo, HubSpot, or Pardot, with knowledge of lead management processes.  
  • Advanced skills in SQL, Excel, and Google Sheets for marketing data analysis.  
  • Experience working with UTM parameters, Google Analytics, and paid media analytics. 
  • Strong understanding of multi-touch attribution (MTA), lead lifecycle reporting, and ABM analytics.

The actual salary may vary based upon several factors, including, but not limited to, relevant skills/experience, time in the role, business line, and geographic location. Restaurant365 focuses on equitable pay for our team and aims for transparency with our pay practices.
  • Comprehensive medical benefits, 100% paid for employee
  • 401k + matching
