jobs.title: Senior Data Analyst
jobs.description:
About the company

At Ocean, we’re on a mission to become the UK’s leading credit platform for people not served by the mainstream, helping them improve their financial wellbeing over their lifetime. This has been our mission for over 30 years, and it’s still the thing that drives us to do better and more for our customers.

We do this by helping our customers make informed decisions and access personal finance products.

If our mission sounds interesting, please keep reading!

About the job

As our new Senior Data Analyst, you’ll bring your analytical prowess and curiosity to work with you, day in, day out. You’ll be an expert at what you do and know exactly how to use your skills to derive actionable insights that drive business decisions and improve customer outcomes. You'll work closely with various stakeholders to understand their needs, transform complex data, develop analytical solutions, and communicate findings effectively. And you’ll be the kind of person that loves to push the boundaries of what’s possible and thrives in a fast-paced environment like ours.

What you’ll be doing for us

The mission statement of the Strategy & Analytics team is “To improve customer and business outcomes by ensuring the sourcing of the most relevant intelligence, and its optimal deployment”. We aim to be a leading force in creating value for the customer and the business, through best-in-class analytics and decisioning that shape the product offering, as well as corporate strategy.

A day in the life of this role could look like…

  • Analyzing complex datasets to uncover customer behavior patterns and product performance insights, translating these findings into clear recommendations for stakeholders
  • Designing and helping to build automated dashboards and reports in tools like Power BI or Tableau to track key business metrics and support data-driven decision making
  • Collaborating with business teams to understand their analytical needs and develop solutions that drive business value
  • Writing and optimizing SQL queries to extract and analyze data from multiple sources, ensuring accuracy and efficiency
  • Presenting insights and recommendations to senior stakeholders, telling compelling stories with data that drive action
  • Analysing market trends and competitive landscape

You’ll also have the chance to get involved in other projects like:

  • Evaluating the potential impact of greenfield projects, such as the integration of new products
  • Set up analytical framework for new products or enhance the existing ones by suggesting new KPIs / analyses
  • Understanding the key drivers behind past business performance and succinctly articulating the story to the board
  • Contributing to the design and implementation of our machine learning and predictive analytics initiatives

Skills-wise, you’ll have:

  • Minimum 4 years of experience in data analysis or business intelligence roles
  • Advanced skills in SQL and Excel
  • Knowledge of Python for data analysis
  • Experience with statistical analysis and data manipulation
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)
  • Experience in financial services or fintech sector
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical thinking abilities
  • Strong commercial acumen with understanding of key business metrics
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Great people skills
  • Highly proactive – you love to take ownership of everything you do

Ideally, you’ll also have:

  • Previous experience in the digital consumer credit space
  • Experience using Google Analytics / other market insight platforms
  • Experience with data transformation tools and practices (e.g., dbt, Spark SQL) to build and maintain basic data pipelines
  • Experience working with cloud data warehouses (e.g., Databricks)
  • Experience with A/B testing and experimentation
  • Knowledge of machine learning concepts and applications
  • Background in mathematics, business analytics, computer science, economics, engineering or related field

Most importantly, you’ll live and breathe our values: Openness, Trust, Humility, Professionalism, Respect, and Passion.

What we’ll do for you

  • Pay you competitively and review your salary every year
  • Welcome you into our awesome team (dare we say the best? We do, yes!)
  • Bring the kind of vibe where we want you to share your ideas, even if it’s not “your area”
  • Provide you with all the kit you need to work from home. Of course, you can also work from our Manchester or Cyprus offices, too.
  • Help you plan for life after work with our pension scheme
  • Take care of your health with eye test vouchers, and our employee assistance programme
  • Give you 25 days holiday (to start with), as well as local public holidays and a day off on your birthday
  • Support you with training, mentoring and anything else you need to further your development and hit your career goals
  • Invite you to regular online and in-person team socials, as well as the occasional team retreat somewhere exotic
  • Help you help others with optional “community” days for volunteering
  • Provide you flexibility of benefit with the Ocean Health Plan

jobs.title: Sr Business Analyst
jobs.description: Job Description: Position Overview The primary responsibility of the Sr Business Analyst is to develop, plan and implement technology solutions to improve business needs. They are responsible for bridging the gap between IT and the Business using analytics to assess processes, determine requirements and deliver recommendations to executives and stakeholders. A strong understanding of the technology landscape and industry acumen is necessary to effectively analyze and document business requirements, workflows and use best practices in collaboration with enterprise architects, application developers, consultants, and vendors. This position will require concurrent work on disparate projects, ranging from system implementations to organizational efficiency initiatives to business development opportunities. The Sr Business Analyst must be able to develop comprehensive requirement documents and process flows, define project scope and objectives, coordinate testing with business stakeholders and Quality Assurance team, conduct and document user acceptance testing, and identify and mitigate risks / issues to deliver the project scope. The ability to professionally engage and effectively communicate with all levels of the organization, including C-level executives, is a fundamental requirement for this position. All duties are to be performed in accordance with departmental and Las Vegas Sands’ policies, practices and procedures. All Las Vegas Sands Corp. Team Members are expected to conduct and carry themselves in a professional manner at all times. Team Members are required to observe the Company’s standards, work requirements and rules of conduct. Essential Duties & Responsibilities Develop business/financial models and metrics to address business critical issues and prioritization Document and analyze business systems and user defined needs. Lead and drive strategic goal setting discussions to understand high level expectations. Partner with business and IT stakeholders to set clear requirements to reach goals and milestones. Define project scope to include objectives, budget, added value and benefits. Facilitate cost and effort estimation sessions with developers and third-party solution providers. Manage and supervise requirements and changes throughout project lifecycle. Engage appropriate participants through detailed testing validation and execution. Ensure delivery of high quality solutions to the business. Audit, analyze, and summarize overall performance and provide results during follow-ups and leadership debrief. Perform job duties in a safe manner. Attend work as scheduled on a consistent and regular basis. Performs other related duties as assigned. Minimum Qualifications At least 21 years of age. Proof of authorization to work in the United States Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in a relevant discipline. Must be able to obtain and maintain any certification or license, as required by law or policy. 5 years of experience as a Business Analyst Demonstrated experience in process mapping, business requirements analysis and documentation, data mapping and test planning. Knowledge and understanding of Agile methodology, BPMN, UML, user interface design. Working knowledge of enterprise modelling suites such as MagicDraw, Sparx Enterprise Architect. Ability to work independently and to effectively manage and execute multiple initiatives concurrently. Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with guests and other Team Members of different backgrounds and levels of experience. Must be able to work varied shifts, including nights, weekends and holidays. Physical Requirements Must be able to: Physically access assigned workspace areas with or without reasonable accommodation. Work remotely as necessary Work indoors and be exposed to various environmental factors such as, but not limited to, CRT, noise, and dust. Utilize laptop and standard keyboard to perform essential functions of the job. In the 1990s, Las Vegas Sands Corp. (NYSE: LVS) created and introduced an entirely new kind of travel destination: the Integrated Resort. As one of the leading global developers of destination properties, we offer an array of high-end amenities and integrated them under one roof to provide the ultimate guest experience. We raised the bar of excellence in the hospitality industry, providing unparalleled guest service, a luxurious atmosphere and a dynamic resort experience with each and every visit. Sands Privacy Policy

jobs.title: Revenue Assurance Analytics Senior Analyst
jobs.description:
Reddit is a community of communities. It’s built on shared interests, passion, and trust and is home to the most open and authentic conversations on the internet. Every day, Reddit users submit, vote, and comment on the topics they care most about. With 100,000+ active communities and approximately 97M+ daily active unique visitors, Reddit is one of the internet’s largest sources of information. For more information, visit redditinc.com.

We are seeking a highly analytical and business-driven Senior Analyst to supercharge Revenue Assurance Analytics at Reddit. This role requires an analytical mindset, a proactive attitude, and a passion for using innovative methods to improve ads delivery, risk management, processes, and controls within a dynamic environment. You will collaborate closely with our ads engineering, ads data science, and finance teams to deliver data and analytics solutions that validate the completeness and accuracy of ads revenue and drive business performance.

What you’ll do

  • Build and implement monitoring and assurance processes and tools to facilitate independent revenue assurance.
  • Perform auction logic validation, ads validation service data quality review, independent platform eventing audits, and recalculate key advertising metrics.
  • Analyze ads platform data to identify trends, patterns, and detect potential anomalies or eventing issues.
  • Design and build automation for independent assurance analytics that provide real time insights into how financial measures are impacted by changes in the platform or business logic.
  • Oversee controls testing to ensure a robust control environment.
  • Partner with cross-functional teams, including Ads Eng, Ads Data Platform, Ads Data Science, and Safety Data Science to provide a risk perspective on the ongoing evolution of our ads business.

Who You Might Be:

  • 3 to 5 years' experience in risk analytics, data analytics, audit analytics, data science, or a related analytical field.
  • A collaborative and proactive problem-solver with exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
  • A self-motivated, results-oriented individual with a strong work ethic and a passion for learning. You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and are comfortable working both independently and collaboratively.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

  • Ability to assess complex processes and environments to identify risks and design safeguards.
  • Working knowledge of SQL/BigQuery and data analytics automation.
  • Understanding of ETL processes, including data enrichment, monitoring, and quality assurance.
  • Experience interpreting business logic implemented in code (Python, JavaScript, SQL etc.).
  • Strong communication skills, able to clearly articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
  • Ability to work under pressure, prioritize multiple activities, and meet strict deadlines.
  • Organized, efficient, and comfortable with ambiguity.

Preferred knowledge, skills and abilities include:

  • Experience with digital advertising platform technology companies.
  • Experience in auditing microservices and collaborating with platform and data engineers.
  • CISA, CPA, or similar certification.

Benefits:

  • Comprehensive Healthcare Benefits and Income Replacement Programs
  • 401k Match
  • Family Planning Support
  • Gender-Affirming Care
  • Mental Health & Coaching Benefits
  • Flexible Vacation & Reddit Global Days off
  • Generous paid Parental Leave  
  • Paid Volunteer time off

 

 

Pay Transparency:

This job posting may span more than one career level.

In addition to base salary, this job is eligible to receive equity in the form of restricted stock units, and depending on the position offered, it may also be eligible to receive a commission. Additionally, Reddit offers a wide range of benefits to U.S.-based employees, including medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k) program with employer match, generous time off for vacation, and parental leave. To learn more, please visit https://www.redditinc.com/careers/.

To provide greater transparency to candidates, we share base pay ranges for all US-based job postings regardless of state. We set standard base pay ranges for all roles based on function, level, and country location, benchmarked against similar stage growth companies. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors including, skills, depth of work experience and relevant licenses/credentials, and may vary from the amounts listed below.

The base pay range for this position is:
$130,000—$185,000 USD

Reddit is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and is committed to building a workforce representative of the diverse communities we serve.  Reddit is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at ApplicationAssistance@Reddit.com.

jobs.title: Game Promo Tools Data Analyst
jobs.description:
To succeed in the role, you will have:

  • 3+ years of analytical work experience, preferably in the online Gaming/iGaming industry or the video streaming industry.

  • BSc/BA in a highly quantitative field such as Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, or equivalent

  • Outstanding analytical and technical skills, with the ability to turn complex data into actionable recommendations

  • Strong SQL skills with experience querying large, complex data sets

  • Strong presentation and data visualization skills and great attention to detail

Preferred additional qualifications:

  • Experience with the online gambling industry domain

  • Pet projects and hobbyist interests in data analysis and machine learning outside work are welcomed (e.g., Kaggle competitions)

What will you be doing?

jobs.title: Lead Data Analyst, Operations & Fulfillment
jobs.description:
Hims & Hers Health, Inc. (better known as Hims & Hers) is the leading health and wellness platform, on a mission to help the world feel great through the power of better health. We are revolutionizing telehealth for providers and their patients alike. Making personalized solutions accessible is of paramount importance to Hims & Hers and we are focused on continued innovation in this space. Hims & Hers offers nonprescription products and access to highly personalized prescription solutions for a variety of conditions related to mental health, sexual health, hair care, skincare, heart health, and more.

Hims & Hers is a public company, traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol “HIMS”. To learn more about the brand and offerings, you can visit hims.com and forhers.com, or visit our investor site. For information on the company’s outstanding benefits, culture, and its talent-first flexible/remote work approach, see below and visit www.hims.com/careers-professionals.

​​About the Role:

As a Lead Data Analyst for Operations Analytics, you will act as a strategic leader in leveraging analytics to drive efficiency, scalability, and innovation across Hims & Hers’ operational functions. You will own the design, execution, and delivery of advanced analytics projects, partnering with cross-functional teams to uncover insights and deliver actionable recommendations. Your expertise in operational data and storytelling will be critical in shaping business strategies and fostering data-driven decision-making at scale.

This lead-level role will involve close collaboration with teams spanning Dispense & Fulfillment, Operations Assurance, Planning & Optimization, Compounding, Supply Chain, and Operations Finance. Reporting to the Senior Manager of Operations Analytics, you’ll operate in a fully remote and highly collaborative environment that values curiosity, growth, and innovation.

You Will:
  • Mentor junior analysts and assist in building a high-performance team of analysts capable of gathering, synthesizing, and analyzing data quickly and accurately
  • Design and implement scalable platforms and processes to enable data-driven decisions across multiple business lines, modalities, and treatment types
  • Tackle complex problems by determining proper analytical methodologies, deriving actionable insights, and presenting conclusions to cross-functional stakeholders
  • Establish and measure key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with throughput and business outcomes, enabling precise performance tracking
  • Identify growth and operational optimization opportunities by structuring and executing experiments in collaboration with cross-functional teams; drive knowledge-sharing and adoption of findings across the organization
  • Proactively initiate and advocate for bold, high-impact strategic opportunities derived from the team’s analytics work, influencing executive-level decisions
  • Leverage internal and external data to uncover growth opportunities, providing actionable, data-driven recommendations for business expansion
  • Partner with teams across Data Engineering, Operations, and Finance to define, build, and execute a data-informed business strategy and operational roadmaps
  • Lead the creation of high-quality dashboards, reports, and insights tailored for executive-level consumption, driving informed decision-making at all levels
You Have:
  • 8-10 years of experience in data engineering, business intelligence, operations, or analytics, with a focus on fulfillment and operational excellence
  • Advanced proficiency in SQL, with intermediate-to-advanced experience in R or Python for data analysis and automation
  • Hands-on experience with tools like Looker, Google BigQuery, and DBT, with the ability to design scalable analytics solutions
  • Exceptional ability to design and execute complex analysis projects, including statistical analysis and process optimization
  • Superb written and verbal communication skills, with experience presenting insights and recommendations to senior, cross-functional stakeholders
  • Strong ability to contextualize data and insights within the business landscape, effectively communicating findings to both technical and non-technical teammates
  • Proven ability to thrive in fast-paced, high-growth, and rapidly changing environments, delivering results under pressure
Preferred:
  • Advanced degree (MS) in Mathematics, Statistics, Data Analytics, or a related field
  • Familiarity with healthcare data, including compliance with HIPAA/PHI, or experience with two-sided marketplace data
  • Demonstrated ability to challenge conventional approaches and drive innovative, high-impact decisions
  • Knowledge of operational KPIs and best practices across fulfillment, logistics, supply chain, and customer service
  • Proficient understanding of statistical analysis, data science concepts, experimentation and how to implement that knowledge into the functional areas within Operations 
  • Experience working with DBT and implementing best practices with modeling data
 Benefits (there are more but here are some highlights):
  • Competitive salary & equity compensation for full-time roles
  • Unlimited PTO, company holidays, and quarterly mental health days
  • Comprehensive health benefits including medical, dental & vision, and parental leave
  • Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)
  • Employee discounts on hims & hers & Apostrophe online products
  • 401k benefits with employer matching contribution
  • Offsite team retreats

#LI-Remote

Outlined below is a reasonable estimate of H&H’s compensation range for this role for US-based candidates. If you're based outside of the US, your recruiter will be able to provide you with an estimated salary range for your location.

The actual amount will take into account a range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including but not limited to skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, and location. H&H also offers a comprehensive Total Rewards package that may include an equity grant.

Consult with your Recruiter during any potential screening to determine a more targeted range based on location and job-related factors.

An estimate of the current salary range is
$155,000—$190,000 USD

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.

Hims considers all qualified applicants for employment, including applicants with arrest or conviction records, in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance, the California Fair Chance Act, and any similar state or local fair chance laws.

It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

Hims & Hers is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at accommodations@forhims.com and describe the needed accommodation. Your privacy is important to us, and any information you share will only be used for the legitimate purpose of considering your request for accommodation. Hims & Hers gives consideration to all qualified applicants without regard to any protected status, including disability. Please do not send resumes to this email address.

To learn more about how we collect, use, retain, and disclose Personal Information, please visit our Global Candidate Privacy Statement.

jobs.title: Sr. Data Analyst
jobs.description:
About Us
Luxury Presence is the leading digital platform revolutionizing the real estate industry for agents, teams, and brokerages. Our award-winning websites, cutting-edge marketing solutions, and AI-powered mobile platform empower real estate professionals to grow their business, operate more efficiently, and deliver exceptional service to their clients. Trusted by over 60,000 real estate professionals, including 31 of the nation’s 100 top-performing agents as published in the Wall Street Journal, Luxury Presence continues to set the standard for innovation and excellence in real estate technology.

Position
Title: Sr. Data Analyst
Location: U.S. Based, Remote
Compensation: 120k-170k, Stock Options, Flex PTO, Health/Vision/Dental, Retreats

Why Now?
We’ve enjoyed tremendous growth over the last 5 years. With that growth comes a treasure trove of data that is valuable to us, and our customers. We need experienced and passionate data analysts to help us realize that value and unlock the insights that exist at the intersection of our operational, financial, and product data. This is a unique opportunity to join a fast growing startup and build our data team, culture, and processes from the ground up.


What You’ll Do
  • Deliver recommendations and actionable insights to key stakeholders to help drive revenue
  • Use strong technical and business intuition to optimize GTM motions, ensuring data-driven approaches drive efficiency, revenue growth, and customer acquisition.
  • Solve difficult open ended up problems through novel data solutions and analytics.
  • Support development of predictive models to support strategic and operational initiatives
  • Build dashboards, data products, and ad hoc report studies to analyze and present data associated with GTM analytics, product performance, business operations, and strategic decision making
  • Work with key stakeholders and the leadership team to define and monitor KPIs across the company
  • Build production-ready data models and schemas using DBT to support downstream analytics


    • Must Haves
  • Proficiency in SQL
  • Proficiency in any statistical programming language (i.e, Python or R)
  • 5+ years in doing analytics with a robust understanding of statistical concepts
  • Experience working with BI tools (Sigma, Tableau, SiSense, Hex, or Looker etc)
  • Experience building predictive/forecasting models
  • Ability to work independently, and lead projects from start to finish
  • Ability to handle multiple stakeholders, and prioritize competing requests
  • Ability to identify and push for process improvements for the teams we support
  • Ability to communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences through visualizations and presentations
  • Ability to partner with leadership and stakeholders across the company to understand business needs and how these can be addressed through analytics
  • Experience supporting any GTM teams including Sales, Marketing, or Customer Success


    • Nice to Haves
  • M.S. in Math, Statistics, or closely related quantitative field
  • Experience with Snowflake and dbt
  • Experience building supervised and unsupervised learning models
  • Experience working in a B2B or SaaS company
    • Join us in shaping the future of real estate

    The real estate industry is in the midst of a seismic shift, and the future belongs to those who break new ground. As one of the fastest-growing companies in the proptech and marketing sectors, Luxury Presence challenges the status quo of what technology can do for real estate agents, leaders, and brokerages. 

    We’re a team of agile and tenacious innovators working collaboratively to drive the industry forward. Together, we build game-changing products that empower modern real estate entrepreneurs to dominate their markets. From award-winning web design to agile SEO solutions to cutting-edge AI tools, we deliver tech that anticipates market shifts and keeps our clients ahead of their competition. 

    Founded in 2016 by Stanford Business School alum Malte Kramer, Luxury Presence has grown to a global team ranked on the Inc. 5000 fastest-growing companies list three years in a row. We’re backed by world-class investors, including Bessemer Venture Partners, Toba Capital, and Switch Ventures, and have raised $52.6 million to date. 

    More than 13,000 real estate businesses rely on our platform, including 31 of the RealTrends top 100 agents featured in The Wall Street Journal. Additionally, many of the industry’s most powerful brokerages — including Compass, Coldwell Banker, and Sotheby’s International Realty — rely on Luxury Presence as a trusted business partner.

    Every year since 2020, Luxury Presence has ranked on BuiltIn’s Best Place to Work lists. HousingWire named our founder and CEO a 2024 Tech Trendsetter, we’ve received several Tech100 Awards, and our lead nurturing tool just scored an Inman Innovation Award for Best AI-Powered Platform.

    Luxury Presence is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

jobs.title: Analyst II, Product Insights
jobs.description:
The Product Insights team’s mission is to deliver a strategic vision so that Included Health can impact the Quintuple Aim of healthcare: improved member experience, better health outcomes, lower costs, clinician well-being, and health equity. We are responsible for internal analytics and partner with a wide variety of cross-functional teams including operations, finance, product, clinical as well as data science and data engineering. Data is at the heart of everything we do here at Included Health, and our team uses it to give our partners super powers. This encompasses everything from understanding what our members need, improving our product features, optimizing our operations, and many other critical business decisions.

We’re looking for candidates with excellent analytical ability and strategic intuition to help continue our efforts in demystifying and removing the complexity from healthcare.  This is a phenomenal opportunity for someone with a passion for improving healthcare, and someone who is curious and interested in becoming an expert across multiple domains.  

About the Role
Drive insight generation for complex projects both independently and in collaboration with cross-functional teams.
Identify opportunities to better engage and navigate members so that we can drive top quartile outcomes at bottom quartile costs.
Develop a deep understanding of how our products are being used and identify opportunities to better serve our members’ needs.
Prototype novel approaches to measuring or inferring product and business performance.
Develop dashboards with key visualizations for tracking product and business performance.
Connect the dots on how our operational performance drives health outcomes.
Scale our impact so we can bring our services to more people in need.



Project Examples
  • Identifying opportunities to drive higher clinical engagement for individuals with the greatest healthcare needs and develop an understanding of how individuals using our platform think about engaging with our clinical services.
  • Defining clinical quality models to power the tool we use to match members to high quality providers.
  • Analyzing administrative and clinical documents using NLP-derived topic tags to understand why members call us and how well we are meeting their needs.
  • Assessing key opportunities to reduce our costs so that we may serve more members.
  • Measuring our impact on population level health outcomes so we can demonstrate our value to customers.



    • Requirements
  • 3+ years of work experience in highly quantitative roles or equivalent and relevant advanced degrees.
  • Ability to effectively communicate complex quantitative patterns into strong narratives to support business decisions.
  • Ability to independently drive results working on complex, ambiguous projects with a major quantitative component.
  • Ability to navigate and join across multiple complex data sets using relational databases (examples include SQL, Pandas, R).
  • Strong written and oral presentation skills.
  • You excel with collaborative projects that include cross-functional teams.
  • Experience creating dashboards in Looker or Tableau is preferred.

    • The United States new hire base salary target ranges for this full-time position are:

    Zone A: $77,390 - $100,610 + equity + benefits  
    Zone B: $88,990 - $115,702 + equity + benefits  
    Zone C: $96,738 - $125,763 + equity + benefits  
    Zone D: $100,669 - $130,793 + equity + benefits  

    This range reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for candidates based on their respective Zone. Below is additional information on Included Health's commitment to maintaining transparent and equitable compensation practices across our distinct geographic zones.

    Starting base salary for the successful candidate will depend on several job-related factors, unique to each candidate, which may include, but not limited to, education; training; skill set; years and depth of experience; certifications and licensure; business needs; internal peer equity; organizational considerations; and alignment with geographic and market data. Compensation structures and ranges are tailored to each zone's unique market conditions to ensure that all employees receive fair and competitive compensation based on their roles and locations. Your Recruiter can share details of your geographic alignment upon inquiry.



    In addition to receiving a competitive base salary, the compensation package may include, depending on the role, the following: 

    Remote-first culture
    401(k) savings plan through Fidelity
    Comprehensive medical, vision, and dental coverage through multiple medical plan options (including disability insurance)
    Full suite of Included Health telemedicine (e.g. behavioral health, urgent care, etc.) and health care navigation products and services offered at no cost for employees and dependents 
    Generous Paid Time Off ("PTO") and Discretionary Time Off (“DTO")
    12 weeks of 100% Paid Parental leave
    Family Building Benefit with fertility coverage and up to $25,000 for Surrogacy & Adoption financial assistance
    Compassionate Leave (paid leave for employees who experience a failed pregnancy, surrogacy, adoption or fertility treatment) 
    11 Holidays Paid with one Floating Paid Holiday
    Work-From-Home reimbursement to support team collaboration and effective home office work 
    24 hours of Paid Volunteer Time Off (“VTO”) Per Year to Volunteer with Charitable Organizations

    Included Health is a new kind of healthcare company, delivering integrated virtual care and navigation. We’re on a mission to raise the standard of healthcare for everyone. We break down barriers to provide high-quality care for every person in every community — no matter where they are in their health journey or what type of care they need, from acute to chronic, behavioral to physical. We offer our members care guidance, advocacy, and access to personalized virtual and in-person care for everyday and urgent care, primary care, behavioral health, and specialty care. It’s all included. Learn more at includedhealth.com.
